item.text: Now Naaman, the commander of the king of Syria’s army, was esteemed and respected by his master, for through him the Lord had given Syria military victories. But this great warrior had a skin disease.

<st data-num="01416" class="">Raiding parties</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> from <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st> and <st data-num="07617" class="">took captive</st> from the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> a <st data-num="06996" class="">young</st> <st data-num="05291" class="">girl</st>, who <st data-num="01961" class="">became</st> a <st data-num="06440" class="">servant</st> to <st data-num="05283" class="">Naaman’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>.
She told her mistress, “If only my master were in the presence of the prophet who is in Samaria! Then he would cure him of his skin disease.”
Naaman went and told his master what the girl from the land of Israel had said.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="01980 0935">Go</st>! I will <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> a <st data-num="05612" class="">letter</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.” So Naaman<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st>, <st data-num="03947" class="">taking</st> with <st data-num="03027" class="">him</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, <st data-num="08337 0505" class="">6,000</st> shekels of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="02487" class="">suits</st> of <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>.

He <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">letter</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>. It <st data-num="0559" class="">read</st>: “<st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> <st data-num="06258" class="">is</st> a <st data-num="05612" class="">letter</st> of <st data-num="0935 0413">introduction</st> for my <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="05283" class="">Naaman</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02009" class="">whom</st> I have <st data-num="07971 0413">sent</st> to be <st data-num="0622" class="">cured</st> of his <st data-num="06883" class="">skin disease</st>.”

When the king of Israel read the letter, he tore his clothes and said, “Am I God? Can I kill or restore life? Why does he ask me to cure a man of his skin disease? Certainly you must see that he is looking for an excuse to fight me!”

When Elisha the prophet heard that the king of Israel had torn his clothes, he sent this message to the king, “Why did you tear your clothes? Send him to me so he may know there is a prophet in Israel.”

So <st data-num="05283" class="">Naaman</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> with his <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st> and <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> in the <st data-num="06607" class="">doorway</st> of <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>.

<st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">out</st> a <st data-num="04397" class="">messenger</st> who <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> him, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> and <st data-num="07364" class="">wash</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">times</st> in the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st>; your <st data-num="01320" class="">skin</st> will be <st data-num="07725" class="">restored</st><n id="1" /> and you will be <st data-num="02891" class="">healed</st>.”
Naaman went away angry. He said, “Look, I thought for sure he would come out, stand there, invoke the name of the Lord his God, wave his hand over the area, and cure the skin disease.

The <st data-num="05104" class="">rivers</st> of <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st>, the <st data-num="071" class="">Abana</st> and <st data-num="06554" class="">Pharpar</st>, are <st data-num="03808 02896">better</st> than <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> of the <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>!<n id="1" /> Could I <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07364" class="">wash</st> in them and be <st data-num="02891" class="">healed</st>?” So he <st data-num="06437" class="">turned around</st> and <st data-num="01980" class="">went away</st> <st data-num="02534" class="">angry</st>.

His <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="05066" class="">approached</st> and <st data-num="01696 0559">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him,<n id="1" /> “O <st data-num="01" class="">master</st>,<n id="2" /> if the <st data-num="05030" class="">prophet</st> had <st data-num="01696 0413">told</st> you to do some <st data-num="01419" class="">difficult</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">task</st>,<n id="3" /> you would have <st data-num="03808" class="">been willing</st> to <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> it.<n id="4" /> It seems you <st data-num="0637" class="">should be happy</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> he simply <st data-num="0559 0413">said</st>, ‘<st data-num="07364" class="">Wash</st> and you will be <st data-num="02891" class="">healed</st>.’”<n id="5" />
So he went down and dipped in the Jordan seven times, as the prophet had instructed. His skin became as smooth as a young child’s and he was healed.

He and his entire entourage returned to the prophet. Naaman came and stood before him. He said, “For sure I know that there is no God in all the earth except in Israel! Now, please accept a gift from your servant.”
But Elisha replied, “As certainly as the Lord lives (whom I serve), I will take nothing from you.” Naaman insisted that he take it, but he refused.

Naaman said, “If not, then please give your servant a load of dirt, enough for a pair of mules to carry, for your servant will never again offer a burnt offering or sacrifice to a god other than the Lord.

May the Lord forgive your servant for this one thing: When my master enters the temple of Rimmon to worship, and he leans on my arm and I bow down in the temple of Rimmon, may the Lord forgive your servant for this.”

Elisha said to him, “Go in peace.”

When he had gone a short distance,

Gehazi, the prophet Elisha’s servant, thought, “Look, my master did not accept what this Syrian Naaman offered him. As certainly as the Lord lives, I will run after him and accept something from him.”

So <st data-num="01522" class="">Gehazi</st> <st data-num="07291" class="">ran</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> <st data-num="05283" class="">Naaman</st>. When <st data-num="05283" class="">Naaman</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> someone <st data-num="07323" class="">running</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> him, he <st data-num="05307" class="">got down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> his <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">meet</st> him and <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st>, “Is <st data-num="07965" class="">everything all right</st>?”<n id="1" />

He <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, “<st data-num="07965" class="">Everything is fine</st>.<n id="1" /> My <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> me with <st data-num="0559" class="">this message</st>, ‘<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="05288" class="">servants</st> of the <st data-num="01121 05030">prophets</st> <st data-num="06258 02088">just</st> <st data-num="0935 0413">arrived</st> from the <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraimite</st> <st data-num="02022" class="">hill country</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> them a <st data-num="03603" class="">talent</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> and <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02487" class="">suits</st> of <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>.’”

<st data-num="05283" class="">Naaman</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="02974" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">accept</st> two <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st> of silver.”<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="06555" class="">insisted</st>, and <st data-num="06887" class="">tied up</st> two <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> in <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02754" class="">bags</st>, along with <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02487" class="">suits</st> of <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>. He <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> them <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> of his <st data-num="05288" class="">servants</st> and they <st data-num="05375" class="">carried</st> them <st data-num="06440" class="">for</st> Gehazi.<n id="2" />
When he arrived at the hill, he took them from the servants and put them in the house. Then he sent the men on their way.
When he came and stood before his master, Elisha asked him, “Where have you been, Gehazi?” He answered, “Your servant hasn’t been anywhere.”

Elisha<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559 0413">replied</st>, “I <st data-num="03808 01980">was there</st> in <st data-num="03820" class="">spirit</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">when</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="02015" class="">turned</st> and got down <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> his <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">meet</st> you.<n id="2" /> This is not the <st data-num="06256" class="">proper time</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">accept</st> <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> or to <st data-num="03947" class="">accept</st> <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>, <st data-num="02132" class="">olive groves</st>, <st data-num="03754" class="">vineyards</st>, <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st>, <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st>, and <st data-num="05650" class="">male</st> and <st data-num="08198" class="">female</st> <st data-num="05650 08198">servants</st>.<n id="3" />
Therefore Naaman’s skin disease will afflict you and your descendants forever!” When Gehazi went out from his presence, his skin was as white as snow.
